author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are uppercase.
- Name is not at least five characters long
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: julia
- Package name similar to 18 existing packages.
<details>
<summary>Similar package names</summary>

1. Similar to BED. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1. Normalized visual distance 1.37 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
2. Similar to BDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1. Normalized visual distance 1.72 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
3. Similar to ODE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 2.01 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
4. Similar to C3D. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 2.29 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
5. Similar to EDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
6. Similar to MD5. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
7. Similar to PDDL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
8. Similar to FDM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
9. Similar to AMD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
10. Similar to BBI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
11. Similar to SDDP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
12. Similar to JLD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
13. Similar to XDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
14. Similar to JDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
15. Similar to Bio. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
16. Similar to BAT. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
17. Similar to ADI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
18. Similar to CUDD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
</details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Bump @RenatoGeh.

Regarding the name, perhaps `BinaryDecisionDiagrams` is a better name?

> Bump @RenatoGeh.
> 
> Regarding the name, perhaps `BinaryDecisionDiagrams` is a better name?

Sure. My only concern was already existing users that might have their package and code break (plus `using BDD` was such a simple quaint one-liner). But on second thought, I doubt anyone is actually using my package, so why not. Better to have it on the general registry. Is there a way to have both ways? As in, leave the repo as `BDD.jl` but have it on the general registry as `BinaryDecisionDiagrams`?

> As in, leave the repo as BDD.jl but have it on the general registry as BinaryDecisionDiagrams?

Sure, but why? Pretty confusing when they don't match.

@RenatoGeh Here is what I would recommend:
1. Rename this package to `BinaryDecisionDiagrams.jl`
2. When users use your package in their code, tell them to do one of these two options:

Option 1:
```julia
import BinaryDecisionDiagrams as BDD
```

Option 2
```julia
using BinaryDecisionDiagrams
const BDD = BinaryDecisionDiagrams
```

That way, they still get to use the `BDD` abbreviation in their code.
Sounds good. Will work on this once I've got the time.
Hi. Could you guys close this PR, please? This package was merged in on PR #25646 with the discussed changes in naming.
